author: {'steamid': '76561198084506649', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1698714228}
review:
schöne Stimmung vor allem wegen der Grafik und der Musik. Passt super zusammen, Es hat sowas von alten Geisterhausfilmen. Vor allem zu Beginn im Hotel.

Es gibt dort nur leere Orte, keine Menschen und trotzdem gibt es indirekt eine Interaktion.   In der gleichen Zeitlinie sind die Menschen lebendig, aber man sieht sie halt nicht und kann nicht direkt mit ihnen reden. Zeitlabyrinth halt. Nur Momentaufnahmen von versch. Zeiten.

Die Puzzle sind nicht so schwer, aber trotzdem ist es immer interessant wo man als nächstes rauskommt, wenn man wieder in einem der Irrgarten steckt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095293908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 360, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1673572677}
review: A fun classic. The visuals are the big plus of this game as the plot is rather thin. Most of the puzzles are engaging and fun but mostly I just loved watching what visuals the game gave to me. If anything this game suffers as a product of its time with multiple items you pick up but cannot use and a really clunky control system. But if you enjoy 90s point and click adventures this is definitely one to try out. It's a short but enjoyable game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999976451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1668565329}
review:
A sense of nostalgia is restored after finishing this game for the first time since I played it in the 2000.
It used to run on DOS / windows95 with CD support on a 100Mhz pentium machine.


It Works on Linux, have some quick saves options build in, music plays properly, you can skip the intro.
Movement arround the mazes can be done with arrow keys, fullscreen view toggle is available with F1.

The cons :
The ending scene is kinda disapointing after the atmospheric build up.
The items are wreidly placed and many things are unexplained, it is part of its charm however, I've spend so many hours trying to figure out the logic of the puzzles however for some there is none.
Some interresting items you grab are pointless while others more mundane are key to the success of the your run.

Keep in mind that you operate in a frozen time continuum, changes you engage in a past keyframe can affect future keyframes.
- There is one hidden key in the music box at the bar (silver color).
- Before stealing the last artefact in the lunar base be sure to have the brass key
- To avoid running out of coins make sure to insert one in the phone booth, coins are needed to enter the garden maze from the phonebooth side.
- dont waste your coins on the fortune teller before solving the puzzle in the theater

author: {'steamid': '76561199409217639', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1668894947}
review: I played for the nostalgia, I stayed for the graphics.  Fun little game I bought back when it was first released. If you remember 7th Guest fondly you'll probably enjoy this '90s game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172925593', 'num_games_owned': 14021, 'num_reviews': 4532, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1630334735}
review:
相当有年代感的点击解谜游戏
操作上过于复杂，所有行为都只能通过下方的动作条来实现，甚至包括转向
你需要时刻查看地图来确定自己的朝向，以免移动错误
以及你必须要在每一个感觉需要调查的地方，尝试每一个操作事件，并没有如今的一键行天下的便捷

整体质量并不算太好，同年代也存在更优秀的同类游戏

author: {'steamid': '76561198967575435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1614875241}
review: Toen het spel pas uit was speelde ik deze op de pc van toen ter tijd. Fantastische ervaring en de muziek is heel erg mooi. De muziek was in eerste instantie niet gemaakt voor dit spel. De makers van deze muziekstukken zijn te vinden op het internet en is zeker een aanrader om deze in je collectie op te nemen. Zeker na het spelen van dit spel krijgt het een bijzondere betekenis. Kortom... het is een oud spel maar echt de moeite waard. Ik hoop op een remake van dit spel maar dan met de huidige technieken...

author: {'steamid': '76561198390702163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1569381316}
review:
I was attracted to this game because I saw some screenshots of it, and I like checking out more obscure games.
As much as I love the graphics though, the actual gameplay is not very fun. The controls and navigation are kind of weird and hard to get used to. The puzzle solutions are that sort of point-and-click brand of obstinate that made me want to look at a guide a lot, plus there are a lot of mazes to navigate. (Admittedly it is called "The [i]Labyrinth[/i] of Time" for a reason.)
I still haven't finished this game because I got stuck pretty far in (I think?) because of something I messed up at the beginning, and I haven't felt like restarting in order to finish it. ::-(

Overall, I love how it looks, and there are a lot of really cool locations. The gameplay makes it hard to enjoy. Maybe someone else with more patience will enjoy it?

author: {'steamid': '76561198067371366', 'num_games_owned': 2090, 'num_reviews': 583, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1602937135}
review:
Sadly I can't recommend this game, and I don't believe it could be called a classic. The fact it unfortunately came out a few months before Myst does not take out the fact it is in itself not a good game. It has good ideas, and wants to tell a nice story, but ultimately it is quite academic, boring, and repetitive. So much wandering in labyrinths without anything to do, and with totally unjustified and random environments. The art also is quite messy, and often doesn't fit. It is not an awful game, just mediocre/bad. So many text adventures are better than this, and to be fair, if you need to play fantasy 3D puzzle games from the 90s, Myst is the masterpiece.

My [b][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/36483989/]other Reviews[/url][/b]. Join me on [b][url=https://www.twitch.tv/hemandwatch]Twitch[/url][/b] and [b][url=https://discord.gg/crnuted]Discord[/url][/b]!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055546014', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1498901287}
review: Criminally forgotten adventure game. Keep in mind that there are "western adventure game"isms like pointless items, unwinnable situations, etc. but still a relatively friendly game all in all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994971393', 'num_games_owned': 2927, 'num_reviews': 288, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1565084856}
review: Kind of adorably bad, it's hard not to appreciate the effort that must have gone into this game, made by two people back in 1993. Still, as adorable as it is, I can't say I recommend anyone actually play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017956515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1589732699}
review: This game has a bizarre aesthetic that I honestly love. Almost impossible to win without either a guide or a lot of trial and error, but I think even with a guide it's worth seeing what this game has to offer. If nothing else, it's good for a surreal time. Play it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993862065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1492979053}
review:
1990s-era point-and-click that's showing its age.

The puzzles and controls are just too annoying and the graphics are dated. The story didn't hook me, so I didn't feel a desire to try to finish this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1507347009}
review:
Tags: Adventure - WC - Walk Clicker
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Abandonware Grade. Works fine. Finnicky and features adventure game concepts that are universally regarded as poor game design such as dead end scripting and moon logic. 

This is a linear point&click adventure game with scripting that can leave you stuck in dead ends. The navigation is confusing due to the disconnected nature of the still shots. The control scheme is non standard and uses an odd point&click adventure interface. Most icons will usually fail working on most scenery objects making the trial and error a little bit frustrating. Narratively the game is interesting and pits you as an everyday joe getting contacted by some kind of atlantis parallel dimension kind of person, so that gives an excuse for mismatched assets and rather fantasy-ish looking stills. However the obscure nature of the puzzles, the reliance on mazes, lack of ability to fullscreen correctly on widescreen monitors, odd control scheme, and dated audiovisual quality really detracts from the immersiveness and even I would say just flat out usability.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981356193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1500538740}

author: {'steamid': '76561198102785982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1471814587}
review:
It took me quite a while to decide whether or not I'd recommend this game.  I like it, let's be clear on that, but I love this type of game in general, so that is certainly affecting my judgement.  But many other games do this better, and this game engages in some prime sins of bad point and click adventures.

Pros:

Gorgeous artwork
Nicely varied locations
Decent puzzles
Good music

Cons:

Counter intuitive control scheme
Repetitive Mazes
No settings access

Sins:

1.  Looking at an object should never result in the message "Nothing Happens."  Everything you look at should have a description, and if you're looking at something that was never programmed to be looked at, the message should at least say something more like "This isn't anything important."
2.  You can work yourself to points where you are stuck, but not dead.  This shouldn't happen in this type of game.  You should always be able to progress, or, if you can't, see that the game has ended.
3.  There are many items which you can pick up which serve no purpose in the game.  If they do, and I just don't see it, then I apologize, ignore this complaint, and in small doses this is okay, but during the course of the game there were more items in my inventory which I did not use than those that I did.  
4.  There is not much to do compared to the amount of area you can cover.  I've gone through huge mazes that had nothing important inside them (for example, the hedge maze) and may as well have been one room.  it doesn't encourage the type of exploration a player will want to take part in.

Verdict:  If you're REALLY jonesing for a stroll through the adventure games of the 90s, get it.  it's cheap.  I got it on sale, when it was REALLY cheap, and for the price, it was worth it.  If you want a good point and click game from the 90s though, I could better recommend:

Myst
Lighthouse
Shivers
The Journeyman Project Series

Check those out first, they're all a lot more fun, if you can get your hands on them.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984484210', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1541055734}
{'steamid': '76561198019187718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1434252479}
review:
Make no mistake: The Labyrinth of Time is an adventure game from 1993. Most of the puzzles are mazes and inventory fetch quests. Much of the story is told through journals. There are a few ways to get stuck. If you doesn't sound appealing, steer clear. But if that's your speed and you want an adventure game experience with a unique artistic sensibility, this is a must-play.

The world of the Labyrinth is a patchwork of surrealism, Art Deco, and classical architecture. The art direction is mesmerizing. There is simply nothing else like it in any game. Every room is with worth seeing, every useless inventory item worth examining, every dead-end worth the trek. The dark, horror-influnced soundtrack reinforces the idea that the Labyrinth is a truly alien place, and the light-sci-fi archaeological time travel story is also entertaining.

By the end, the constant backtracking and repetitive mazes can get a little tiring. But The Labyrinth of Time deserves a look for its art and atmosphere.
